content.title: Assistance to Scheduled Caste Farmers for Installation of Submersible / Centrifugal Motor Pumpsets With Accessories
content.department: Department of Agriculture and Farmer's Welfare
content.details: The scheme 'Assistance to Scheduled Caste Farmers for Installation of Submersible / Centrifugal Motor Pumpsets With Accessories' was launched by the Department of Agriculture and Farmer's Welfare, Union Territory of Puducherry. Through this scheme, the farmers from the Scheduled Caste Category are provided with a grant of 90% subsidy towards the installation of suitable Submersible / Centrifugal motor pump sets with accessories, subject to a maximum of ₹60,000/‐ per tubewell per individual.
benefits: 90% subsidy towards the installation of suitable Submersible / Centrifugal motor pump sets with accessories, subject to a maximum of ₹60,000/‐ per tubewell per individual.
eligibility: The applicant should be from the Scheduled Caste Category.
The applicant should be a farmer in the Union Territory of Puducherry.
The tubewell in which the submersible/centrifugal motor pump sets is going to be erected should have been registered in Pondicherry Ground Water Authority, Puducherry.

The applicant should hold a minimum of 1.5 acres of land under the command area of the tubewell to be constructed and should have ownership of the land for at least 2 years with a clear ownership title deed.
Farmers who have already availed themselves of the subsidy for the said purpose within 5 years are not entitled to any benefit under this scheme.
The applicant should not convert the lands for a maximum period of 10 years from the date of construction of the tubewell/filter point to any purpose other than agriculture.
content.application_process: Offline and Online. The applicant must obtain the mandatory PERMIT for the construction of a new/replacement tubewell from the Pondicherry Ground Water Authority, Puducherry. The application should be submitted within 90 days from the date of completion of the tubewell/filter point construction work.
documents_required: The Nationality, Nativity, Caste Certificate and a Certificate issued by an officer not below the rank of the Deputy Tahsildar.
The certificate for the ownership of the land issued by an officer, not below the rank of Deputy Tahsildar.
The copy of the Registration certificate, Permit and Energisation Certificate issued by the Pondicherry Ground Water Authority, Puducherry.

Original bills for the expenses incurred towards the construction of the tubewell or, in case of those who have availed themselves of a Bank loan, attested copy of the original bills and certificate from the Bank to that effect.
Copy of the Aadhaar card, Farmers Identity Card, and Bank passbook front page.

faqs.question: Can the land be mortgaged, sold, or transferred during the 10-year commitment period?
faqs.answer: No, the land cannot be mortgaged, sold, or transferred to any other person during the 10-year commitment period specified in the affidavit.

faqs.question: What action may the government take if a beneficiary breaches the scheme's conditions?
faqs.answer: In case of a breach, the government may take legal action and initiate recovery/cancellation of subsidy from the beneficiary.

faqs.question: How is the subsidy amount released if the applicant uses personal funds for construction?
faqs.answer: If the applicant uses personal funds for construction, the subsidy amount is released through the Electronic Clearing System (ECS).

faqs.question: What is the role of the Pondicherry Ground Water Authority in the scheme?
faqs.answer: The authority issues the registration certificate, permit, and energization certificate for the tubewell.

faqs.question: Can the applicant convert the land for purposes other than agriculture during the 10-year restriction period?
faqs.answer: No, the applicant is prohibited from converting the land for any purpose other than agriculture during the 10-year restriction period.

faqs.question: What should beneficiaries submit after selection to affirm their commitment to the scheme's conditions?
faqs.answer: Upon selection, beneficiaries must submit an affidavit, signed before a Notary Public, committing to retain and use the land for agriculture for a period of 10 years.

faqs.question: Is there a time restriction for applicants who have previously availed themselves of the subsidy?
faqs.answer: Farmers who have received the subsidy for the same purpose within the last 5 years are not eligible for benefits under this scheme.

faqs.question: What is the minimum land requirement for eligibility under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants must hold a minimum of 1.5 acres of land under the command area of the tubewell, with ownership for at least 2 years.
